author: NewsBreak Original
title: VIDEO: Santa Barbara Novelty Wave Goes Nuts During Historic Dec. 28th Swell
text: In case you havenâ€™t heard, California went absolutely bonkers on December 28th, 2023 with a swell that some were calling the â€œbiggest day in yearsâ€ at certain spots. Specifically, Mavericks, the Golden Stateâ€™s premier big-wave surf spot located just south of San Francisco, stole the show during the swell with epic rides , heavy wipeouts , an historic first for alternative surf craft , and spectators swept away by a sneaker wave . But, of course, Mavs wasnâ€™t the only place inundated with waves during the swell. Elsewhere was huge, too; and in some cases, almost too big. Take this mutant, massively crowded, endlessly entertaining to watch, wintertime novelty wave â€“ which will remain nameless â€“ from Santa Barbara. Backwash blasting surfers into oblivion, an unrelenting current that would turn Michael Phelpsâ€™ arms into noodles, and a few diamonds in the roughâ€¦thatâ€™s what we get in the edit above featuring the super secret, yet notoriously crowded, surf spot. This wave wasnâ€™t the only Santa Barbara surf spot to light up during the swell, however. A couple clicks to the south, Rincon, the Queen of the Coast, was doing her thing as well. Check out the full photo gallery from that day here ; and hereâ€™s a report from local hero, Conner Coffin: â€œIn all honesty, this is one of the biggest swells Iâ€™ve seen around here and it pretty much overloaded a lot of spots by mid day. I think every parking spot around was taken and everyone was on it. â€œIt was one of the biggest and cleanest days Iâ€™ve surfed. It was packed in the morning but as the swell pulsed it cleared out.â€ *** Don't miss another headline from SURFER! Subscribe to our newsletter , follow us on Instagram , and stay connected with the latest happenings in the world of surfing. We're always on the lookout for amusing, interesting and engaging surf-related videos to feature on our channels. Whether you're a professional surfer or just an amateur, we want to see your best footage and help you share it with the world. Submit your video for a chance to be featured on SURFER and our social channels. Be sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel to watch high-quality surf videos.

title: Un hombre se siente fatal tras una fiesta pero no esperaba ese brutal diagnÃ³stico: sus compaÃ±eros evitan sentarse a su lado
text:
Un hombre se siente fatal tras una fiesta pero no esperaba ese brutal diagnÃ³stico: sus compaÃ±eros evitan sentarse a su lado
Presentaba vÃ³mitos con sangre.
Ivo (nombre ficticio) no esperaba que una noche de fiesta iba a acabar en un diagnÃ³stico tan malo. El joven se fue a disfrutar de una jornada lÃºdica en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus amigos, en la que ingiriÃ³ alcohol, como solÃ­a hacer.
Al despertar por la maÃ±ana, se encontraba mal y presentaba un cuadro de vÃ³mitos acompaÃ±ados de sangre. PensÃ³ que debÃ­a ser un problema de estÃ³mago, pero la sangre no cesaba tras devolver. AcompaÃ±ado de sus amigos, que evitaban sentarse a su lado ante la grandes cantidades de este lÃ­quido que salÃ­a de su cuerpo, llamaron a una ambulancia, tambiÃ©n motivados por los vecinos, alertados ante el estado en el que encontraron a Ivo en las escaleras.
El hombre fue trasladado al Hospital Universitario ClÃ­nico Oriental de Riga donde, tras las primeras pruebas, lo condujeron a otra sala. AllÃ­ permaneciÃ³ aislado de los demÃ¡s pacientes.
â€œTiene tuberculosisâ€, recuerda Ivo en palabras de los mÃ©dicos. Una noticia muy dolorosa pero que, gracias a los facultativos, entendiÃ³ que de no haber ingresado y actuado rÃ¡pido, el final podrÃ­a haber sido fatal.
Â¡Mantente al dÃ­a con El Huffpost! Sigue todas las noticias desde tu mÃ³vil en nuestra APP. Puedes descargarla tanto para Android como iOS.

author: VNExplorer
title: Why Amazon's CEO thinks the company's generative AI could be the next big thing
text: Amazon, which has maintained a relatively low profile in the field of generative artificial intelligence compared to Microsoft and Google, announced on Thursday that it is expanding its capacity to boost the technology globally and contribute to its democratisation. The worldâ€™s biggest e-commerce company said its cloud subsidiary Amazon Web Services will become an integral component of the future generative AI boom. â€œWe are optimistic that much of this world-changing AI will be built on top of AWS,â€ Andy Jassy, Amazonâ€™s chief executive, said in his annual letter to shareholders on Thursday. Amazonâ€™s share price jumped 1.67 per cent to close at $189.05 on Thursday. The companyâ€™s market capitalisation stood at $1.96 trillion. AWS revenue increased 13 per cent to $91 billion last year. Photo: AWS Generative AI technology was catapulted into the spotlight with ChatGPT, which was launched by Microsoft-backed OpenAI in December 2022. It is a programme that comes up with humanlike responses to prompts in seconds, based on information publicly available on the internet. However, its use and accuracy have come under scrutiny. In December, Alphabet-owned Google launched Gemini, which became the first AI model to beat human experts on MMLU (Massive Multitask Language Understanding), one of the most widely used methods to test the knowledge and problem-solving abilities of the technology. Globally, AI investments are projected to hit $200 billion by 2025 and could possibly have a bigger impact on gross domestic product, Goldman Sachs Economic Research said in a report in August. Mr Jassy, who become the chief executive in 2021 after the companyâ€™s founder Jeff Bezos stepped down, said future generative AI opportunities are numerous. â€œGenerative AI may be the largest technology transformation since the cloud, and perhaps since the internet â€¦ the amount of societal and business benefit from the solutions that will be possible will astound us all.â€ In his letter to shareholders, Mr Jassy indirectly criticised rivalsâ€™ AI models, saying Amazon offers models from various companies, such as Anthropic, Stability AI, Meta, Cohere as well as its own models, instead of relying solely on one dominant AI model. â€œCustomers donâ€™t want only one model. They want access to various models and model sizes for different types of applications,â€ he added. Last year, Amazonâ€™s total revenue grew 12 per cent yearly to $575 billion, while AWS revenue increased 13 per cent to $91 billion. The company is expected to announce its last quarter earnings on April 25.News Related - AWS and Clarity AI to use generative AI to boost sustainable investments Cloud computing experts, builders, customers, partners, and technology enthusiasts descend on Las Vegas to attend AWS re:Invent event that runs through December 1. Photo: AWS Amazon Web Services, the worldâ€™s biggest cloud services provider, has expanded its partnership with technology platform Clarity AI to help investors and consumers advance sustainable ...
